1. INTER-DEPARTMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE

What year did you start housekeeping in eastern Canada? 1915.
Where did you get your housekeeping? Windsor, Ont.
Where had you been living before that? Windsor, Ont.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 2 people.
How far was it to your nearest store? 10 miles.
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a week.
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Beans, oatmeal.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Redwood.
In what quantities did you buy it? 6 bags.
Was this usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.00.
How much did you use per meal? 1/4 lb.
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes, but far away? No.
That was the price for a twenty pound bag or rolled oats? $1.00.
What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal.
Cornmeal?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No, just at the mill.
How did you grind it?
